abstract.text: A class containing all administrator and moderator functionality of the
API library.
Updates the handle of a user account as an administrator.
Updates a subject status of an account, record, or blob.
Delete’s a user account as an administrator.
Turns on the ability for the user account to receive invite codes again.
Gets details about a user account.
Get details about a repository as an administrator.
Updates the email address of a user account as an administrator.
Represents an authenticated user session within the AT Protocol. Optional.
Updates the password of a user account as an administrator.
Defines a protocol for configurations in the
API library.
A class containing all administrator and moderator functionality of the
API library.
Disables a user account’s ability to receive future invite codes as an administrator.
Retrieves the invite codes from a user account.
Sends an email to the user’s email address as an administrator.
Disables some or all of the invite codes for one or more user accounts as an administrator.
Gets details about a moderation event.
Searches for repositories as an administrator or moderator.
List all moderator events pertaining a subject.
Attempts to authenticate the user into the server.
Creates a communication template for administrators and moderators.
Enacts on an action against a user’s account as a moderator.
Gets the status of a subject as an administrator.
Gets details from multiple user accounts.
Retrieves a list of communication templates.
Creates a report to send to moderators.
Initializes a new instance of
Gets details about a record as an administrator pr moderator.
Gets the moderation statuses of records and repositories.
Deletes a communication template as an administrator or moderator.
Manages authentication and session operations for the a user account in the ATProtocol.
The base class that handles the main functionality of the
API library.
